DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject Class

In this Article

Provides information about a DataGridViewCell to accessibility client applications.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
protected class DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject : System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • MarshalByRefObject
  • StandardOleMarshalObject
  • System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject
  • DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject

Remarks

Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications. Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject class inherits from the AccessibleObject class to provide information about a DataGridViewCell to accessibility client applications. Each class that represents a visual part of the DataGridView—such as DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell, DataGridViewRowHeaderCell, DataGridViewRow and DataGridViewCell—also contains a class that inherits from AccessibleObject to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the DataGridView control, to accessibility client applications. There are two ways of providing this additional information. To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's AccessibleName and AccessibleDescription property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

Note

You should change the AccessibleDefaultActionDescription and AccessibleRole property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a DataGridView look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom DataGridView or DataGridViewCell. To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the DataGridView+DataGridViewAccessibleObject or DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject classes and override the CreateAccessibilityInstance method. For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the DataGridViewRowHeaderCell+DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject class and override the CreateAccessibilityInstance method.

The DataGridView exposes its data structure by using AccessibleRole values to define the data table hierarchy. For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Constructors

  • DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject()

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject class without initializing the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property.

    public DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject ();
  • DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject(DataGridViewCell)

    Initializes a new instance of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject class, setting the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property to the specified DataGridViewCell.

    public DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell owner);

    Parameters

    • owner
      DataGridViewCell

      The DataGridViewCell that owns the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

Properties

  • Bounds

    Gets the location and size of the accessible object.

    public override System.Drawing.Rectangle Bounds { get; }

    Property Value

    • Rectangle

      A Rectangle that represents the bounds of the accessible object.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The Bounds property retrieves the object's bounding rectangle in screen coordinates.

  • DefaultAction

    Gets a string that describes the default action of the DataGridViewCell.

    public override string DefaultAction { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string "Edit".

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

  • Help

    Gets the names of the owning cell's type and base type.

    public override string Help { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The names of the owning cell's type and base type.

    Remarks

    This property returns a string that includes the owning cell's type name followed by the name of its base type in parentheses, such as "DataGridViewTextBoxCell (DataGridViewCell)".

  • Name

    Gets the name of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The Name property returns a string that includes the column header text and the row index of the DataGridViewCell.

  • Owner

    Gets or sets the cell that owns the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell Owner { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridViewCell

      The DataGridViewCell that owns the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      When setting this property, the Owner property has already been set.

  • Parent

    Gets the parent of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Parent { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

      The parent of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The Parent property returns a DataGridViewRow+DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject, which represents the DataGridViewRow that contains the DataGridViewCell.

  • Role

    Gets the role of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole Role { get; }

    Property Value

    • AccessibleRole

      The AccessibleRole value.

  • State

    Gets the state of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates State { get; }

    Property Value

    • AccessibleStates

      A bitwise combination of AccessibleStates values.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The return value always includes the AccessibleStates and AccessibleStates values. It also includes the AccessibleStates value if the associated cell is selected, the AccessibleStates value if the cell has keyboard focus, and the AccessibleStates value if the cell is not currently displayed.

  • Value

    Gets or sets a string representing the formatted value of the owning cell.

    public override string Value { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A String representation of the cell value.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The Value property contains a string that represents the value of the cell FormattedValue property. If FormattedValue is null, Value contains the string "(null)".

    Setting this property has no effect if the owning cell is a header cell, is read-only, or does not belong to a row. Otherwise, setting this property:

    • Ends any edit currently in progress and commits the value.

    • Uses the cell GetFormattedValue and ParseFormattedValue methods to convert the specified value to the type indicated by the cell ValueType property.

    • Sets the cell value to the converted value.

Methods

  • DoDefaultAction()

    Performs the default action associated with the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override void DoDefaultAction ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

      -or-

      The value of the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject property is not null and the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.RowIndex* property of the DataGridViewCell returned by the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is equal to -1.

    Remarks

    If the cell associated with this DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject is a DataGridViewHeaderCell, this method does nothing. Otherwise, this method selects the cell, makes it the current cell, and takes one of the following actions:

    • If the cell's ReadOnly property value is true, this method returns.

    • If the cell's EditType property value is null, meaning the cell cannot host an editing control, this method returns.

    • If the cell is currently entering or leaving edit mode (for example, if this method is called in a CellBeginEdit or CellEndEdit event handler), this method returns.

    • If the cell is currently in edit mode, this method commits and ends the edit.

    • If the cell is not in edit mode and the EditMode property is set to DataGridViewEditMode, this method returns.

    • If none of the preceding actions is taken, this method causes the cell to enter edit mode.

  • GetChild(Int32)

    Returns the accessible object corresponding to the specified index.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject GetChild (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the child accessible object.

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

      An AccessibleObject that represents the accessible child corresponding to the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The GetChild method returns an AccessibleObject only if the DataGridViewCell that owns the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject is in edit mode and index is 0.

  • GetChildCount()

    Returns the number of children that belong to the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.

    public override int GetChildCount ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      The value 1 if the DataGridViewCell that owns DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject is being edited; otherwise, –1.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

  • GetFocused()

    Returns the child accessible object that has keyboard focus.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject GetFocused ();

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

      null in all cases.

  • GetSelected()

    Returns the child accessible object that is currently selected.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject GetSelected ();

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

      null in all cases.

  • Navigate(AccessibleNavigation)

    Navigates to another accessible object.

    public override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject Navigate (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation navigationDirection);

    Parameters

    • navigationDirection
      AccessibleNavigation

      One of the AccessibleNavigation values.

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject

      A DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject that represents the DataGridViewCell at the specified AccessibleNavigation value.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The following table describes which DataGridViewCell owns the DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject that is returned by the Navigate method for each parameter value.

    Parameter value Description
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewCell to the right of the current cell. Navigate returns null if the current cell is in the right-most column.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewCell to the left of the current cell. Navigate returns an accessible object for the row header if the current cell is in the left-most column.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewCell that has the next higher index. Navigate returns null if the current cell is in the first column.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewCell that has the next lower index. Navigate returns null if the current cell is in the last column.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewCell in the same column and one row above the current cell. Navigate returns null if the current cell is in the first row.
    AccessibleNavigation The DataGridViewCell in the same column and one row below the current cell. Navigate returns null if the current cell is in the last row.
    All other AccessibleNavigation values null.
  • Select(AccessibleSelection)

    Modifies the selection or moves the keyboard focus of the accessible object.

    public override void Select (System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection flags);

    Parameters

    • flags
      AccessibleSelection

      One of the AccessibleSelection values.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The value of the stem.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner* property is null.

    Remarks

    The following table describes the action performed by the Select method for each flags value.

    Parameter value Action
    AccessibleSelection The DataGridView takes focus.
    AccessibleSelection The DataGridViewCell that owns this DataGridViewCell+DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject takes focus.
    AccessibleSelection The DataGridViewCell is added to the SelectedCells property.
    AccessibleSelection The DataGridViewCell is removed from the SelectedCells property.
    All other AccessibleSelection values No action is taken.
